de.haukesomm.healthdemo.data

Class SessionDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • de.haukesomm.healthdemo.data.SessionDatabase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class SessionDatabase
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Created on 23.08.18

    This class manages the SQlite database containing all recorded fitness Sessions. It includes methods to add, remove or list Sessions.
    By default it is populated with mockup data provided by the SessionAssetReader class.

      Creates a new SessionDatabase object which can be used to manipulate the database.

      • open

        public void open()
        Call this method to manually open the database connection. By default this is not required since the constructor already opens a connection.
        See Also:
        close()

      • close

        public void close()
        This method closes the existing database connection. All method reading from / modifying the database will stop working until you manually re-establish the connection by invoking open() ()}.
        Call this method when you are finished working with the database or use a try-with-resources block!
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Overrides:
        close in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper

      • listSessions

        public java.util.List<SessionDescription> listSessions()
                                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a List of all available sessions in form of SessionDescriptions.
        Returns:
        List of SessionDescriptions
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If there is no active database connection
